subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|五%輪 の 石%塔|ご%りん の せき%とう}}, {{ja-r|五%輪 の 塔|ご%りん の とう}}: a five-ring or five-level stone [[stupa]]
* {{ja-r|仏塔|ぶっとう}}: a [[Buddhist]] [[reliquary]] [[stupa]]; a Buddhist [[temple]] [[pagoda]] or [[stupa]]
* {{ja-r|五%重 塔|ご%じゅう の とう}}, {{ja-r|五%重 の 塔|ご%じゅう の とう}}: a five-[[storey]] [[pagoda]]
* {{ja-r|石塔|せきとう}}: a [[stone]] [[pagoda]] or [[stupa]]; a Buddhist [[tombstone]]
* {{ja-r|三%重 塔|さん%じゅう の とう}}, {{ja-r|三%重 の 塔|さん%じゅう の とう}}: a three-[[storey]] [[pagoda]]
* {{ja-r|塔%屋|とう%や}}: a [[penthouse]]; a structure on top of a building, possibly the top of the elevator shaft, the stairs, ventilation equipment, or a water tower
* {{ja-r|塔%花|とう%ばな}}: [[genus]] {{taxlink|Clinopodium|genus|noshow=1}}, including wild mints and basils; [[slender]] [[wild]] [[basil]] ({{taxlink|Clinopodium gracile|species|noshow=1}})
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|塔%型 クレーン|とう%がた クレーン}}: a tower [[crane]]
* {{ja-r|塔克拉瑪%干 砂%漠|^タクラマ%カン さ%ばく}}: the [[Taklamakan Desert]]
* {{ja-r|塔主|たっす}}, {{ja-r|塔司|たっす}}: job [[title]] for the [[caretaker]] of a [[Buddhist]] [[cemetery]]
* {{ja-r|塔%頭|たっ%ちゅう}}, {{ja-r|塔%中|たっ%ちゅう}}: in [[Zen]] [[Buddhism]], the location of a [[stupa]] for a past master or founder; the [[title]] of the [[monk]] in charge of that stupa; a small [[chapel]] within a larger [[temple]]
* {{ja-r|塔頭|たっちょう}}: an old [[grave]]; a [[graveyard]], a [[cemetery]]
* {{ja-r|塔%婆|とう%ば}}: a [[stupa]]: short for {{m|ja|卒塔婆|tr=sotōba}}
* {{ja-r|塔%廟|とう%びょう}}: a [[Buddhist]] [[reliquary]] [[stupa]]
* {{ja-r|塔望%遠鏡|とうぼう%えんきょう}}: a tower [[telescope]], a tower [[observatory]]
* {{ja-r|塔里木|^タリム}}: the [[Tarim Basin]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Pagoda}} [[File:Chokeiji03s2048.jpg|thumb|250px|{{m|ja|塔}|tr=tō}}: a '''[[pagoda]]'''.]]
{{IPAchar|/tapu/}} > {{IPAchar|/taɸu/}} > *{{IPAchar|/tawu/}} > {{IPAchar|/tau/}} > {{IPAchar|/tɔː/}} > {{IPAchar|/toː/}} From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=とう|-}} {{ltc-l|塔|tower, pagoda, spire}}. An abbreviation for {{m|ja|卒塔婆|tr=sotoba , sotōba}}, a transliteration of {{der|ja|sort=とう|sa|स्तूप||heap}} .

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Idioms
Suffix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|とう|hhira=たふ|suffix}}

# {{qualifier|in general}} a [[tower]]
# {{qualifier|Buddhist}} a [[pagoda]], a [[stupa]]
# {{qualifier|Christian}} a [[steeple]], [[spire]]
# {{qualifier|of a castle or fortification}} a [[turret]]

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text: First appears in the ''{{w|Engishiki}}'' compilation of laws created in the early 900s, spelled phonetically in kanji as {{lang|ja|阿良良伎}} (''araragi''). Spelled as {{m|ja|蘭}}, ''araragi'' literally means “wild onion” and refers to the wild [[rocambole]], possibly [[hardneck]] [[garlic]], notable for its tall green stalk sticking straight up. Used as a [[euphemism]] for {{lang|ja|塔}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> (''tafu'' at the time), as that word's Buddhist connotations were viewed as [[taboo]] in contexts having to do with the religious center of ''Itsuki no Miya'' ({{l|ja|斎宮}}, also known as ''{{w|Saikū}}'').

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|あららぎ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あららぎ|obsolete|euphemism}} a [[tower]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=あららぎ|tarot}} the [[tower]], the sixteenth [[trump]] or [[major arcana]] [[card]] in most traditional Tarot decks
# {{short for|lang=ja|sort=あららぎ|塔舞|tr=Araragimai|nocap=1|dot=:}} the title of a piece of bugaku Japanese court dance

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|塔%舞|^あららぎ%まい}}: the title of a piece of bugaku Japanese court dance
